pullrequest.title: BulletHingeJoint fixes: allows Atlas to load, fix #493, #497

content.raw:
This is probably a plugin problem but occasionally I get a crash when loading simple arm gripper which uses a revolute joint.

here is the output

```
#!c++

gzserver: /home/ian/packages/bullet-2.81-rev2613/src/BulletDynamics/ConstraintSolver/btSequentialImpulseConstraintSolver.cpp:947: virtual btScalar btSequentialImpulseConstraintSolver::solveGroupCacheFriendlySetup(btCollisionObject**, int, btPersistentManifold**, int, btTypedConstraint**, int, const btContactSolverInfo&, btIDebugDraw*, btStackAlloc*): Assertion `found' failed.

```
Doesn't happen in gdb so couldn't get a backtrace.

At times that it doesn't crash, the simple arm gripper simply goes bananas
content.html:
This is probably a plugin problem but occasionally I get a crash when loading simple arm gripper which uses a revolute joint.

here is the output

gzserver: /home/ian/packages/bullet-2.81-rev2613/src/BulletDynamics/ConstraintSolver/btSequentialImpulseConstraintSolver.cpp:947: virtual btScalar btSequentialImpulseConstraintSolver::solveGroupCacheFriendlySetup(btCollisionObject**, int, btPersistentManifold**, int, btTypedConstraint**, int, const btContactSolverInfo&, btIDebugDraw*, btStackAlloc*): Assertion `found' failed.

Doesn't happen in gdb so couldn't get a backtrace.

At times that it doesn't crash, the simple arm gripper simply goes bananas

pullrequest.title: BulletHingeJoint fixes: allows Atlas to load, fix #493, #497

content.raw: Just out of curiosity, do we check if `_axis` is a unit vector?
content.html: Just out of curiosity, do we check if _axis is a unit vector?

pullrequest.title: BulletHingeJoint fixes: allows Atlas to load, fix #493, #497

content.raw:
I changed the documentation to state that the _axis parameter should be a vector with non-zero length, and the direction of that vector will be used to determine the axis direction (see 915dd2c).

The length of the _axis parameter should be checked, and then _axis should be normalized. I do this for BulletHingeJoint and BulletSliderJoint, but I'm not sure what the ODE joints do.
content.html:
I changed the documentation to state that the _axis parameter should be a vector with non-zero length, and the direction of that vector will be used to determine the axis direction (see 915dd2c).

The length of the _axis parameter should be checked, and then _axis should be normalized. I do this for BulletHingeJoint and BulletSliderJoint, but I'm not sure what the ODE joints do.

content.raw: Is this message correct? It seems like `::SetAxis` is implemented.
content.html: Is this message correct? It seems like ::SetAxis is implemented.

pullrequest.title: BulletHingeJoint fixes: allows Atlas to load, fix #493, #497

content.raw: Calling SetAxis with BulletHingeJoint and BulletSliderJoint only has an effect when called before Init, when the joint is created. This error refers to calling SetAxis after Init has been completed. I believe there is a bullet API for modifying this, but I haven't yet implemented it.
content.html: Calling SetAxis with BulletHingeJoint and BulletSliderJoint only has an effect when called before Init, when the joint is created. This error refers to calling SetAxis after Init has been completed. I believe there is a bullet API for modifying this, but I haven't yet implemented it.

pullrequest.title: BulletHingeJoint fixes: allows Atlas to load, fix #493, #497

content.raw: I changed it to an error message, but I don't have a consistent pattern for dealing with these checks. I also don't always check the axis _index parameter.
content.html: I changed it to an error message, but I don't have a consistent pattern for dealing with these checks. I also don't always check the axis _index parameter.

content.raw:
is this `EXPECT_TRUE` placed here to deliberately make the test fail?

how about replacing the if-else statement starting at line 818 with: 
`ASSERT_TRUE(link) << "Error loading link...etc"`
content.html:
is this EXPECT_TRUE placed here to deliberately make the test fail?

how about replacing the if-else statement starting at line 818 with: ASSERT_TRUE(link) << "Error loading link...etc"

pullrequest.title: BulletHingeJoint fixes: allows Atlas to load, fix #493, #497

content.raw: I use that EXPECT to mark the test as a failure since not all the links were able to be tested, but I don't want to abort the test if it's not necessary. It's useful to see how much the test can do successfully.
content.html: I use that EXPECT to mark the test as a failure since not all the links were able to be tested, but I don't want to abort the test if it's not necessary. It's useful to see how much the test can do successfully.
